install.name: Zen Tools
install.author: Joomla Bamboo

install.description:
Zen Tools makes creating image and content galleries for Joomla simple.

The module features the following layouts:

  • Grid galleries
  • Responsive Slideshows
  • Responsive Carousels
  • Masonry Layouts
  • Accordions
  • Simple Lists and more

You can use this module to display your Joomla content, your k2 items or even images from a folder.

Please ensure you read the documentation contained within the module or via the Zentools demo site.

Please ensure that you also have either the Zen Grid Framework plugin or the JB Library plugin in order to use this module.

param.name: categoryFilter
param.label: Category Filter
param.description: This option provides a list of the categories that the items in the module are referenced from. When the user clicks on the category title the module either hides or shows the items that are published in that specific category. Please note that this option will only work with the grid and list layout types.

param.name: directory
param.label: Image Directory
param.description: Directory images will be sourced from - this is the relative directory eg images/stories/.

param.name: random_image
param.label: Fetch random images
param.description: When enabled the images are referenced from a folder and displayed in the module in a random order. Each page refresh delivers the images arranged in a different order.

param.name: prefix
param.label: Order images based on prefix?
param.description: When enabled the image title are broken into the following elements: image number | title | text | articleid | itemid. When disabled the image title is broken into the following elements: title | text | articleid | itemid. We do this so that you can force the ordering of the images int he folder by adding a suitable alphanumeric prefix to the image title.

param.name: separator
param.label: File name separator character
param.description: Enter the character you want to use in your file names in order to render a space in the output of the module. As an example a file named A+Happy+Picture.jpg will output in the module as A Happy Picture if the separator is nominated is the + symbol. If you have trouble with the file manager renaming or removing the separator you choose please try using another character to render spaces in the module output.

param.name: translateDate

param.description: If this option is set to yes the options below are not used. Rather the date is displayed according to your language file.

param.name: dateString

param.description: If this option is set to yes the options below are not used. Rather the date is displayed according to your language file.

param.name: dateFormat
param.label: Date Format if not using translation method
param.description: Date format to use if you have set the translate option above to no

param.name: disableMargin
param.label: Disable margin between grid items?
param.description: When enabled the default right margin attribute is disabled and the items within the grid will sit directly next to each other.

param.name: overlayGrid
param.label: Add an overlay effect?
param.description: When enabled this option implements an overlay effect where the first item sits beneath the other items displayed in the module. This effect is best used when the image is the first item in the list below and when the layout selected is either grid or carousel.

param.name: resizeImage
param.label: Resize Images?
param.description: Set this to yes if you would like to Specify the size of the image.

param.name: option
param.label: Resize Method
param.description: The method you would like to use when resizing images.

param.name: image_width
param.label: Width of the resized image
param.description: Set the width of the resized image.

param.name: image_height
param.label: Height of the resized image
param.description: Set the width of the resized image.

param.name: itemImgSize
param.label: K2 Image Size
param.description: This option determines the source file to be used if your item has an image in the K2 item field. Zentools looks for an image in the k2 item field first and if it exists then it uses that image in the item. If the item does not have an image in the K2 Item field then it will look for an image in the introtext if that image exists. If that image does not exist then it will display a placeholder image according to your settings below. If you want to always use the introtext image then you can set this option introtext image and it will bypass looking for an image in the item field.

param.name: usePlaceholder
param.label: Use placeholder image?
param.description: When this settings is enabled a placeholder image is used in the module when an item image is not available. Setting this to no will mean that no image is output in the item if an image is not available.

param.name: imageEffect
param.label: Image Border?
param.description: Use this setting to determine the effect to apply to the image in the layout. The rounded and shadow items relate to css3 styles and will not render on browsers that do not support css3. The image can be further styled in your stylesheet by applying the following stylings for their respective styles .zenshadow img, .zenrounded img, .zenborder img.

param.name: imageFade
param.label: Image fade on hover?
param.description: When this settings is enabled and the user hovers over the image displayed in the item the image will fade from a full opacity to 0.3 opacity.

param.name: masonryWidths
param.label: Masonry Widths
param.description: This option determines the width of the items in the masonry grid. If this option is set to equalise the width of the items, then the items will be displayed with even widths across the width of the parent container eg. if the width is set to three columns then the items in the module will always display in 3 columns regardless of the width of the page. Otherwise if this option is set to retrieve widths specified in the article's meta keywords then each item can have an individual width that is controlled by the first word in the metakeyword for that article. For example if the word four is the first word of the meta keyword for an item then the item will span a four out of twelve columns or a third of the width of the page. If the first word is six then the item will span half or six out of twelve columns across the page.
param.option: Use widths specified in meta keywords

param.name: masonryColWidths
param.label: Widths
param.description: The method you would like to use when resizing images.

param.name: browserThreshold
param.label: Browser Threshold
param.description: Set the browser width that should trigger the change to single column mode. This option will only work if you are using a responsive width layout or a % based layout.

param.name: masonryColumnWidth
param.label: Base Masonry Column Width
param.description: Width in pixels of 1 column of your grid.

param.name: masonryGutter
param.label: Masonry Gutter
param.description: Adds additional spacing between columns.

param.name: minItems
param.label: Minimum Items
param.description: Set the minumum number of items to display in the carousel. As you reduce the width of the browser and the carousel container this number of items will remain visible in the carousel.

param.name: carouselSpeed
param.label: Carousel Speed
param.description: The speed for the carousel to move to the next group of items.

param.name: imageW
param.label: Carousel item width
param.description: The width of each item in the carousel.

param.name: overlayCarousel
param.label: Add an overlay effect?
param.description: When enabled this option implements an overlay effect where the first item sits beneath the other items displayed in the module. This effect is best used when the image is the first item in the list below and when the layout selected is either grid or carousel.

param.name: slideshowTheme
param.label: Slideshow Theme
param.description: This setting applies specific css to your slideshow to recreate specific layouts. The overlay theme is focussed on using the image as a background and overlaying the text and other elements on top of the image. The flat layout displays the items in a flat list like layout in the module..

param.name: overlayAnimation
param.label: Animate details in Overlay theme?
param.description: When enabled the slideshow items that sit on top of the slideshow image when using the Overlay theme slide up and slide down as the main image transitions from one image to the next.

param.name: slideshowAuto
param.label: Enable slideshow autoplay
param.description: When enabled the slideshow will automatically cycle through the slides available in the slideshow.

param.name: slideshowLoop
param.label: Continuous Loop
param.description: If this settign is enabled the slideshow will cycle continuously through the available slides. If the setting is disabled then the slideshow will stop at the last slide.

param.name: transition
param.label: Slideshow transition
param.description: Determines the transition behaviour when the slideshow moves from one slide to the next.

param.name: slideshowSpeed
param.label: Slide Duration
param.description: The speed for the slideshow transition

param.name: slideshowDuration
param.label: Transition Speed
param.description: The tiem that each slide stays on the screen

param.name: slideshowPaginationType
param.label: Pagination type
param.description: Select the type of pagination used for the slideshow.

param.name: thumb_width
param.label: Thumb Width
param.description: The width of the thumbnail image - without px

param.name: thumb_height
param.label: Thumb Height
param.description: The height of the thumbnail image - without px

param.name: slideCount
param.label: Slideshow count
param.description: When enabled a count of the number of items in the slideshow are displayed on the page.

param.name: slideCountSep
param.label: Slide count separator
param.description: This option allows you to place a string in between the current slide and the total number of slides on the page if the setting above is enabled.

param.name: slideshowNav
param.label: Enable navigation
param.description: When enabled next and previous arrows will be rendered inside the module.

param.name: slideshowPause
param.label: Display pause / play button
param.description: When enabled a button will appear that is able to pause or play the slideshow.

param.name: playText
param.label: Play Text
param.description: The text used to display the play command

param.name: pauseText
param.label: Pause Text
param.description: The text used to display the pause command

param.name: modalTitle
param.label: Display Item Title
param.description: When enabled, the title of the item will appear in the lightbox content area.

param.name: modalImage
param.label: Display Image
param.description: When enabled, the title of the item will appear in the lightbox.

param.name: modalText
param.label: Display Intro Text
param.description: When enabled, the introtext of the item will appear in the lightbox.

param.name: modalVideo
param.label: K2 Video
param.description: When enabled, and if the K2 Media field is populated a video will display in the modal window.

param.name: modalHeight
param.label: Modal window height
param.description: This option sets the height of the modal window if the content type is set to either content or K2. Please note: If you are using the alternate link option in Joomla 2.5 the iframe will load at 98% of the screen size regardless of the height assigned here.

param.name: modalWidth
param.label: Modal window width
param.description: This option sets the width of the modal window if the content type is set to either content or K2.Please note: If you are using the alternate link option in Joomla 2.5 the iframe will load at 98% of the screen size regardless of the width assigned here.

param.name: fancyTitle
param.label: Lightbox title
param.description: If set to yes the title of the item will appear in the lightbox and be displayed according to the option selected below. This setting is different to the title setting above in that title is positioned outside of the lightbox content.

param.name: fancyTitleType
param.label: Lightbox title position
param.description: This setting determines the placement of the title of the item in the lightbox.

param.name: fancyOverlayShow
param.label: Use the overlay?
param.description: If set to yes a transparent overlay will appear above the page and under the popup box.

param.name: fancyOverlay
param.label: Overlay Opacity
param.description: If the previous option is set to yes this value controls the transparency of the overlay. 1 is entirely opaque while 0 is no overlay colour.

param.name: fancyPadding
param.label: Popup Padding
param.description: This value determines the amount of space that surrounds the image in the popup and the edge of the popup itself. Just a numerical value is required without the px

param.name: twitterUsername
param.label: Twitter Username
param.description: Set the twitter username that you would like to display tweets from.

param.name: twitterAvatarSize
param.label: Avatar size
param.description: Enter the size of the user avatar. You can set this to 0 if you want to not show an avatar on the page.

param.name: twitterRefresh
param.label: Refresh Time
param.description: Enter the size of the time in seconds that the module should take in between updating the twitter status.

param.name: scripts
param.label: CSS and Javascript
param.description: This option can be used to remove all javascript and css from being loaded by the microblog module. If in doubt leave this option enabled. If you are using the Zen Grid framework version2 then the scripts and css files will be loaded via the framework. If your site uses caching then the relevant files will be loaded into the body of your site.

param.name: cache
param.label: Caching
param.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

param.name: cache_time
param.label: Cache Time
param.description: The time before the module is recached
